page.title: 06Leebotwood
page.content: Leebotwood is the largest village in this area with the widest variety of houses.These range from old timbered buildings to very modern houses and bungalows.The village has a shop,a Post Office and the Pound Inn, all situated beside the A.49 which runs right through Leebotwood and is seen as a hazard to children and the elderly. Mains water and electricity are available and most homes have modern equipment such as electric cookers, freezers,fridges and television.There is no mains drainage and septic tanks are widely used.There is a small new estate with its own drainage system. Mains gas is not available. Many villagers work on farms, some commute to nearby towns but unemploy- ment is a problem for young people.The population is mainly elderly.
